linefit

Class LineFit

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • linefit.LineFit
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    class LineFit
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    The main operating class in LineFit that is called on start up and sets up the base and layout and that handles all the functions calls and methods of the program
    Since:
    <0.98.0
    Version:
    1.1.0
    Author:
    Unknown

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  LineFit.changeNumberOfColumnsListener
      A Listener class that handles when the user changes the number of DataColumns in the current DataSet
      private class  LineFit.KeyShortcutListener
      A Listener class that handles the key board key combination shortcuts such as F2 bringing up help
      private class  LineFit.MenuBarDropDownButtonsListener
      A Listener class that is used for the buttons in the drop down menus from the menu bar at the top of the LineFit window
      private class  LineFit.QuickBarListener
      A Listener class which handles the functionality of all the components on the Quick bar, which is below the Menu Bar and above the GraphArea and the DataSet Table, with the exception of the number of columns selector buttons

      private javax.swing.JSpinner columnSelector
      The JSpinner that allows the user to set the number of DataColumns for the current DataSet
      private DataSet currentDataSet
      The DataSet that is currently selected to be edited or viewed
      (package private) static LinearFitFactory currentFitAlgorithmFactory
      The default FitAlgorithm to use when creating linear fits for the DataSets

      The width of the DataColumns in the DataSets

      The drop down menu that contains the DataSets as well as the currently selected DataSet

      The width of the DataSetTable that displays and allows the current DataSet's data to be edited

      The Default maximum value on the x-axis of the Graph

      The Default minimum value on the y-axis of the Graph
      private javax.swing.JPanel fitDataPanel
      The Panel that is part of the right side bar that contains the currently selected DataSet's linear fit results if a fit is selected
      private javax.swing.JTextArea fitResultsArea
      The JTextArea in which the linear fit's results are displayed to the user.
      private javax.swing.JComboBox<FitType> fitSelector
      The drop down box that allows the user to select the FitType of the current DataSet
      private GraphArea graphingArea
      The GraphArea of this instance of LineFit in which the Graph is drawn
      private javax.swing.JButton graphOptionsButton
      The JButton on the quickBar that allows the user to open up the options for the GraphArea
      private javax.swing.JPanel mainDisplayPanel
      The Panel that contains all the core pieces of LineFit
      private static java.lang.String menuTitles_AboutLineFit
      The String to be displayed for the about LineFit option in the menu bar drop down
      private static java.lang.String menuTitles_Exit
      The String to be displayed for the exit LineFit option in the menu bar drop down
      private static java.lang.String menuTitles_ExportJPG
      The String to be displayed for the export as a JPEG option in the menu bar drop down
      private static java.lang.String menuTitles_ExportPDF
      The String to be displayed for the export as a PDF option in the menu bar drop down
      private static java.lang.String menuTitles_ExportTex
      The String to be displayed for the export as a LaTex file option in the menu bar drop down
      private static java.lang.String menuTitles_LineFitHelp
      The String to be displayed for the LineFit help option in the menu bar drop down
      private static java.lang.String menuTitles_NewWindow
      The String to be displayed for the new file option in the menu bar drop down
      private static java.lang.String menuTitles_OpenFile
      The String to be displayed for the import file option in the menu bar drop down
      private static java.lang.String menuTitles_OpenFileNewWindow
      The String to be displayed for the open file option in the menu bar drop down
      private static java.lang.String menuTitles_SaveFile
      The String to be displayed for the save file option in the menu bar drop down
      (package private) static int QUICK_BAR_HEIGHT
      The height of the quick bar in pixels
      private javax.swing.JPanel quickBar
      The Panel that contains all the often used options, navigation and editing features such as selecting or adding new DataSets
      private javax.swing.JPanel rightSideBar
      The panel along the right side of the LineFit window that contains the current DataSet information as well as the linear fit's results if the current DataSet has a selected fit
      private static long serialVersionUID
      The Serial Version UID so that we know what version it is when we are using it.
      private boolean setLock
      A lock that allows us to prevent the DataSets from updating so we can change things automatically with less computational overhead
      private javax.swing.JComboBox<java.awt.Shape> shapeSelector
      The drop down box that allows the user to select the Shape of the current DataSet
      private javax.swing.SpringLayout springLayout
      The Layout that lets us position buttons where we desire
      private javax.swing.JCheckBox visibleCheckBox
      The JCheckBox that allows the user to make the currently selected DataSet hidden or visible on the Graph

      Centers the LineFit window on the screen

      Centers the passed frame on this window
      private void createDefaultNumberOfColumns()
      Creates and displays the default number of columns for a DataSet
      private void createMenuBar()
      Creates and initializes the menu bar where the user can save, open, export, etc.
      private void createNewDataSet()
      Creates a new DataSet and makes it the currently selected DataSet
      private void createQuickBar()
      Creates and initializes the quick bar at the top of the LineFit below the menu bar that allows us to change GraphSets as well as the FitType, Color, etc.
      private void createRightSideBar()
      Creates and initializes the right side bar for the LineFit display where the current DataSet and its linear fit results are displayed
      (package private) void drawGraphForExport(java.awt.Graphics2D exportGraphics, java.awt.Dimension exportDimensions)
      Draws the current graph using the passed Graphics2D to be used for creating an exported image
      java.lang.String getGraphName()
      Returns the current GraphArea's graph name
      (package private) void initiateLaTexExportStringGeneration(java.lang.StringBuilder outputStringBuilder)
      Saves the LineFit graph as a LaTex file to be used with the linefit.sty file
      (package private) void initiateRecursiveOpen(java.io.BufferedReader inputFileReader, boolean importSettings)
      Opens the given LineFit file in this instance of LineFit using a recursive based opening scheme
      (package private) void intitiateRecursiveSave(java.util.Formatter outputFormatter)
      Recursively saves the LineFit file to a text document by calling GraphArea's recursivelySave function which calls the DataSets' recursivelySave function
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Main - This is the method that starts up the instance of LineFit.
      private void setNumberOfVisibleColumns(int desiredColumns)
      Makes it so that the number of columns in the current DataSet is equal to the given number
      private void setupLayout()
      Sets up the layout of LineFit and places each panel in the right spot
      private void setupQuickBar()
      Creates an initializes the QuickBar which contains things such as the current DataSet selector and the FitType selector
      private void showAboutBox()
      Shows the about frame - called by the action listener
      private void updateCellFormattingInDataSetColumns(DataSet dataSetToUpdateCellsOf)
      Updates the DataColumns to make sure they are displaying the correct values in their cells

        private LineFit(java.lang.String filePathOfFileToLoad)
        Creates a new LineFit and then populates it with the data from the file at the specified file path
        Parameters:
        filePathOfFileToLoad - The file path of the file to load into the new instance of LineFit

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main - This is the method that starts up the instance of LineFit. If a File path is inputed in the args, it will try to load the file at the specified location on startup
        Parameters:
        args - Either empty of the file path of the File to load on start up

        private void updateCellFormattingInDataSetColumns(DataSet dataSetToUpdateCellsOf)

        Parameters:

      • drawGraphForExport

        void drawGraphForExport(java.awt.Graphics2D exportGraphics,
                        java.awt.Dimension exportDimensions)
        Draws the current graph using the passed Graphics2D to be used for creating an exported image
        Parameters:
        exportGraphics - The graphics to draw the graph for exporting with
        exportDimensions - The dimensions to draw the graph with

      • initiateLaTexExportStringGeneration

        void initiateLaTexExportStringGeneration(java.lang.StringBuilder outputStringBuilder)
        Saves the LineFit graph as a LaTex file to be used with the linefit.sty file
        Parameters:
        outputStringBuilder - The StringBuilder that is being used to store and generate the LaTex graph file

      • showAboutBox

        private void showAboutBox()
        Shows the about frame - called by the action listener

      • initiateRecursiveOpen

        void initiateRecursiveOpen(java.io.BufferedReader inputFileReader,
                           boolean importSettings)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Opens the given LineFit file in this instance of LineFit using a recursive based opening scheme
        Parameters:
        inputFileReader - the BufferedReader that is being used to read in the LineFit file
        importSettings - Whether or not to read in the graph settings/options along with the DataSets from the passed BufferedReader containing the input file's data
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - throws any IO exceptions to be dealt with at a higher level

      • intitiateRecursiveSave

        void intitiateRecursiveSave(java.util.Formatter outputFormatter)
        Recursively saves the LineFit file to a text document by calling GraphArea's recursivelySave function which calls the DataSets' recursivelySave function
        Parameters:
        outputFormatter - The Formatter that is being used to save the LineFit file

      • centerOnScreen

        void centerOnScreen()
        Centers the LineFit window on the screen

      • centerOnThis

        private void centerOnThis(javax.swing.JFrame frameToCenter)
        Centers the passed frame on this window
        Parameters:
        frameToCenter - The frame to center on this window

      • getGraphName

        public java.lang.String getGraphName()
        Returns the current GraphArea's graph name
        Returns:
        The graph name of this LineFit's GraphArea
